alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the western City of Chesapeake, the southwestern City of Portsmouth and the southern City of Suffolk through 730 PM EDT... At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Downtown Suffolk, Deep Creek, Holland, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Bowers Hill, Whaleyville, Western Branch, Lummis, Suffolk Airport, Saunders, Magnolia, Wilroy, Nurney, Kilby, Elwood, Chesapeake Airport and Cleopus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
